title: McNeill 20th century env impacts table 9_3 MCQ 2

content.description: ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGE IN THE TWENTIETH CENTURY Item Percent Increase, 1890s–1990s Percent Decrease, 1890s–1990s 1. World economy (World GDP) 1,400% 2. World industrial output 4,000% 3. World energy use 1,300% 4. World carbon dioxide emissions 1,700% 5. World water use 900% 6. World marine fish catch 3,500% 7. World area under agricultural cultivation 2% 8. World number of bird and mammal species 1% 9. World forested area 20% Source: Based on J.R. McNeill, Something New Under the Sun: An Environmental History of the Twentieth-Century World, (New York: W.W. Norton & Co., 2000), Table 12.1, p. 360.
content.question: The changes reflected in which of the following lines in the table are most directly associated with international conflicts over scarce natural resources in the late twentieth century?

topic.text: 9.3: Technological Advances - Debates about the Environment after 1900

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
